other_tests.findings: Nodules of lymphohistiocytic inflammation with ill-defined edges; bronchiolitis obliterans with organizing pneumonia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The lung lesions have not recurred.

other_tests.findings: No evidence of cancer; organizing fibrin, reactive bronchial epithelial cells, histiocytes, and lymphocytes were present.

other_tests.procedure_name: Double-contrast upper-gastrointestinal series with a small-bowel study
other_tests.findings: Normal bowel-gas pattern; slight slowing of esophageal primary stripping waves; severe gastroesophageal reflux without a hiatal hernia.
Revealed no abnormalities; new development of a vague mass-like lesion in the left lower lobe suspected to be a cancerous lesion.

other_tests.date: Three weeks later (after an earlier chest CT scan)
other_tests.findings: Many nodules throughout the lungs had decreased in size; the ground-glass nodule in the left lower lobe had enlarged to 4.2 by 2.6 cm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Several nodules became smaller and some resolved, but new lesions appeared.
